snippet: A growing number of Chinese officials have found themselves ensnared by extortion plots that leverage the public’s disgust for wayward behavior.
abstract: More Chinese officials are finding themselves ensnared by extortion schemes that leverage the public’s mounting disgust for corruption; even those who have resisted wrongdoing are not immune; aided by computer software, blackmailers are sometimes faking evidence to bolster extortion plots.

byline.original: By DAN LEVIN and AMY QIN

lead_paragraph: A growing number of Chinese officials have found themselves ensnared by extortion plots that leverage the public’s disgust for wayward behavior.

headline.main: True or Faked, Dirt on Chinese Fuels Blackmail
headline.print_headline:
True or Faked,
Dirt on Chinese
Fuels Blackmail

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (Communist Party of China)
